strategy: Add L1 regularization to the model to encourage sparsity and potentially reduce overfitting.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Fill missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)
X_test = X_test.reindex_like(X_train, fill_value=0)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model
lasso_model = Lasso(alpha=0.1)
lasso_model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = lasso_model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model performance
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = lasso_model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Drop rows with missing values
X_train.dropna(inplace=True)
X_test.dropna(inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)
X_test = X_test.reindex_like(X_train, fill_value=0)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Drop rows with missing values
X_train.dropna(inplace=True)
X_test.dropna(inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Align test data with training data shape
X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='left', axis=1)[1]

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model
lasso_model = Lasso(alpha=0.1)
lasso_model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = lasso_model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model performance
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = lasso_model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Drop rows with missing values
X_train.dropna(inplace=True)
X_test.dropna(inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Align test data with training data shape
X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='left', axis=1)[1].fillna(0)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model
lasso_model = Lasso(alpha=0.1)
lasso_model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set

# Evaluate model performance
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = lasso_model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Drop rows with missing values
X_train.dropna(inplace=True)
X_test.dropna(inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Align test data with training data shape
X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='left', axis=1)[1].fillna(0)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model
lasso_model = Lasso(alpha=0.1)
lasso_model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = lasso_model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model performance
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = lasso_model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Drop rows with missing values
X_train.dropna(inplace=True)
X_test.dropna(inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Align test data with training data shape
X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='left', axis=1)[1].fillna(0)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Initialize and fit Lasso model
lasso_model = Lasso(alpha=0.1)
lasso_model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = lasso_model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model performance
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = lasso_model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE
